block.p: I have spent a lifetime gaining and losing weight (''How the Body Knows When to Gain or Lose,'' Oct. 17).
I have often lost up to 50 pounds at a time, only to gain it back. Drugs like Ritalin resulted in great loss of weight but had mood disorder consequences.
I have spent a lifetime gaining and losing weight (''How the Body Knows When to Gain or Lose,'' Oct. 17).
I have often lost up to 50 pounds at a time, only to gain it back. Drugs like Ritalin resulted in great loss of weight but had mood disorder consequences.
I had a gastric stapling, which failed. I then had a gastric bypass. The latter resulted in a weight loss of 100 pounds, but I then slowly gained most of that back.
The only method that has been successful is to walk on the treadmill an hour a day.
This results in modest weight loss, and appears to affect metabolism to some extent. I find that as long as I continue the exercise religiously, my weight loss can be maintained.
